title: Israel-Palestine conflict: Is the US's vision of a two-state solution still achievable?
summary: In the same way that Russia's invasion of Ukraine shifted American priorities, Hamas's attack on Israel forced President Joe Biden to turn his attention back to the Middle East.

title: In Gaza, urban warfare has begun
summary: Israeli forces have pushed into the Palestinian enclave, especially in the north, and targeted Hamas's underground network, while hitting the territory with a massive wave of air strikes.

title: Israel-Hamas war: Netanyahu in turmoil
summary: The Israeli prime minister blamed his generals for the security lapses that enabled the October 7 Hamas terrorist attacks, before retracting his statement. Faced with criticism from within the Likud party, his political future appears compromised.

title: The UK hosts the first global summit on the risks associated with artificial intelligence
summary: Prime Minister Rishi Sunak wants to propose the creation of a group of international experts tasked with publishing a report on the state of AI.

title: Women's place in the Church is at the heart of synod's first report on institution's future
summary: The first general assembly of the Synod on Synodality delivered its report on October 28. The question of women and LGBTQ+ inclusion provoked disagreement. Decisions will be made at the second meeting in October 2024.

title: 'Friends' cast release a statement on the death of Matthew Perry: 'We are all so utterly devastated'
summary: Perry was found dead Saturday in a hot tub at his home in Los Angeles. He was 54. On Monday, his cast mates from their hit show spoke out for the first time.

title: Anti-Semitic incidents spread across Russian Caucasus
summary: An airport in Dagestan, a majority-Muslim republic in southern Russia, closed after hundreds stormed the tarmac in search of passengers landing from Israel.

title: Facebook, Instagram to offer paid ad-free subscriptions in Europe
summary: The subscriptions will be launched in November as Meta seeks to 'comply with evolving European regulations.'

title: Macron begins constitutional process to protect abortion rights
summary: The French president announced on Sunday that a constitutional bill to protect the right to abortion would be presented at the end of 2023.

title: Iranian teenager dies in suspicious circumstances reminiscent of Mahsa Amini's death
summary: Attacked in the metro for not wearing a headscarf, 17-year-old Armita Geravand died on Saturday after several weeks in a coma. The regime denies the incident. Her funeral led to several arrests.

title: Elon Musk, the disinformed disinformer
summary: In just one year, the Tesla and SpaceX boss has transformed Twitter into X, a social media network where fake news proliferates. But he himself is a victim of this ecosystem, with his naiveté and gullibility shining through.

title: Football: Nine arrested for violent attack on Lyon bus in Marseille
summary: Sunday night's Ligue 1 fixture between Olympique Lyonnais and Olympique de Marseille was canceled after projectiles were thrown at Lyon's bus, injuring the coach Fabio Grosso.

title: Matthew Perry fans pay tribute at iconic NYC 'Friends' building
summary: After the death on Saturday of the actor who played Chandler Bing in the hit sitcom, fans traveled to the building on the corner of Bedford Street and Grove Street, which served as the exterior shot of the characters' apartments throughout the show's 10 seasons.

title: Israel-Hamas war: Journalists 'explicitly targeted' by strikes in Lebanon, says RSF
summary: Reuters journalist Issam Abdallah was killed and four others from AFP and Al Jazeera were wounded on October 13, according to Reporters Without Borders (RSF).

title: Sweden: Tesla employees strike to defend their wages and social model
summary: The movement began on October 27 to protest the American brand's refusal to sign a Swedish collective bargaining agreement.

title: US auto strike: The workers' vote will be decisive in old industrial America
summary: Will voters follow Donald Trump in his crusade against the unions and the environment, or Joe Biden, who wants to give industry a boost while ensuring a proper ecological transition?

title: Rome's cobblestone streets, embodiments of the Eternal City
summary: With roadwork underway in the Italian capital for the 2025 Jubilee, the question of preserving the 'sampietrini' has resurfaced.

title: Carbon Bombs: The fossil fuel projects dooming the world's climate efforts
summary: The operation of 422 huge oil, gas and coal fields is wiping out the chances of limiting global warming to 1.5°C. For the first time, two French NGOs have identified the companies, banks and governments behind these ticking time bombs.

title: French interior minister dusts off plan to deport 'dangerous' Chechens
summary: Since a terrorist attack in northern France earlier this month, Gérald Darmanin has spoken of resuming deportations to Russia, which have been suspended since the war in Ukraine started.

title: 'Carbon bombs': Why climate preservation relies on halting all fossil fuel expansion projects
summary: Existing infrastructure far exceeds the carbon budget required to stay below 1.5°C. The continued expansion of oil, gas and coal is incompatible with compliance with the Paris Agreement.

title: Messi wins eighth Ballon d'Or as Bonmati claims women's award
summary: Lionel Messi received the Ballon d'Or from David Beckham, the co-owner of Inter Miami, on Monday.

title: ArcelorMittal asked to leave Kazakhstan following tragedy in Kostenko coal mine
summary: A coal mine owned by the multinational company experienced a methane blast that killed 46 miners on October 28, leading Kazakh President Tokayev to call for the company's departure.

title: French police shot and wounded a woman who 'made threats' at a train station
summary: The woman had 'refused to comply with police orders' and threatened 'to blow herself up,' according to a police source. A police officer fired once, seriously wounding her.

title: In Barcelona, censored art now has its own museum
summary: Since 2018, Catalan collector Tatxo Benet has purchased almost 200 artworks from around the world that were subjected to censorship for one reason or another. Around 40 of these are on display in his Museum of Forbidden Art, which opened on October 26.

title: US National Security Advisor Jake Sullivan: 'Protecting civilians in Gaza is a moral and strategic necessity'
summary: In an exclusive interview, National Security Advisor Jake Sullivan explains why the Biden administration feels there is 'a moral and a strategic necessity' to protect Palestinian civilians in the Gaza Strip, as the Israeli army pushes its ground offensive in the northern part of the territory.

title: Paris prosecutor opens investigation after Stars of David found tagged on buildings
summary: The town hall in the 14th arrondissement denounced these taggings in their district as 'anti-Semitic acts.' Similar tags have appeared in recent days in Paris suburbs.

title: 'Carbon bombs' threaten the fight against global warming
summary: An investigation published by Le Monde and based on the work of two French NGOs on 422 fossil fuel extraction megaprojects highlights the cognitive dissonance of governments that continue to authorize fossil fuel projects while claiming to be committed to the energy transition.

title: Israeli hostages: Netanyahu's war cabinet is determined to force Hamas to fold
summary: Israeli forces are stepping up their military operations in the Gaza Strip while claiming to be pursuing their objective of freeing prisoners of the Islamist movement.

title: Israel-Palestine: Six videos to understand the context behind the war in Gaza
summary: Le Monde breaks down the historical and contemporary context behind the conflict in these short explainer videos.

title: Hezbollah wavers over launching a second front against Israel
summary: The most fervent Hezbollah militants do not understand why it has taken so long for Hezbollah to react to the war between Israel and Hamas. Others question the advisability of a new war at a time when Lebanon is already in crisis.

title: World Cup 2034: After Australia's withdrawal, Saudi Arabia is sole bidder to host the competition
summary: On Tuesday, the Australian Football Association announced that it was abandoning its bid to host the 2034 World Cup. The Saudi kingdom has never been so close to becoming the tournament's host country.

title: Louvre Abu Dhabi: A  twist in the antiquities trafficking case?
summary: German art dealer Serop Simonian, who has been suspected of selling objects of dubious provenance to the museum, was extradited to France in mid-September.

title: The Gaza Strip: 20 years of Le Monde covering this increasingly inaccessible territory
summary: Correspondents describe the particular context of the Palestinian enclave, which despite experiencing four conflicts between 2008 and 2021, has received less attention from the media than the West Bank.

title: Israeli airstrike of Gaza's refugee camp leaves dozens dead
summary: Israel confirmed its armed forces carried out an airstrike on the Jabalia refugee camp, saying it killed a top Hamas commander involved in the October 7 attacks.
